snippet: AutoSlash, a car rental site that searches for the best rates, has earned the enmity of Hertz, Enterprise and other rental giants. Airlines haven’t been much warmer to services that help passengers.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column cites failure of car-rental Web site AutoSlash as an example of big companies coming down hard on start-ups that exploit gaping loopholes in their business models to provide better service to their customers; holds companies should offer optimizing services themselves if they are going to prevent entrepreneurs from doing so.
lead_paragraph: AutoSlash, a car rental site that searches for the best rates, has earned the enmity of Hertz, Enterprise and other rental giants. Airlines haven’t been much warmer to services that help passengers.

headline.print_headline: Swatting Down Start-Ups That Help Consumers
headline.seo: Swatting Down Start-Ups With Consumer-Friendly Ideas
headline.main: Swatting Down Start-Ups That Help Consumers
